tool.name: eDentity Metabarcoding Pipeline

param.name: project_name
param.label: Project Name
param.help: A name for your analysis, e.g eDentity, CO1_analysis, Must be one word

param.name: fastq_maxdiffpct
param.label: maximum percentage diff. bases in overlap; default is 100
param.help: Sets the maximum allowed percentage of differences (mismatches) between paired-end reads during the merging step; if the mismatch rate exceeds this threshold, the pair is not merged.

param.name: fastq_maxdiffs
param.label: maximum number of base mismatches in overlap
param.help: Specify the maximum number of non-matching nucleotides allowed in the overlap region. That option has a strong influence on the merging success rate

param.name: fastq_minovlen
param.label: minimum length of overlap between read merged pairs, default is 10

param.name: forward_primer
param.label: Sequence of the forward primer
param.help: Separate by comma if multiple primers we used eg CTAGACTCGTCATCGATGAAGAACGCAG,CTAGACTCGTCAACGATGAAGAACGCAG,CTAGACTCGTCACCGATGAAGAACGCAG

param.name: reverse_primer
param.label: Sequence of the reverse primer
param.help: Separate by comma if multiple primers we used eg TCCTSCGCTTATTGATATGC,GTGYCAGCMGCCGCGGTAA,GGACTACNVGGGTWTCTAAT

param.name: anchored
param.label: are the primers anchored?
param.help: Set to true if the primers are anchored at both ends of the reads.

param.name: discard_untrimmed
param.label: Discard untrimmed reads
param.help: Set to false if you want to keep reads that do not have primers.

param.name: minlen
param.label: minlen
param.help: Specifies the minimum length of sequences that will be retained after merging paired-end reads; sequences shorter than this threshold will be discarded.

param.name: maxlen
param.label: maxlen

param.name: maxee
param.label: maxee

param.name: fasta_width
param.label: fasta_width
param.help: Fasta files produced by vsearch are wrapped (sequences are written on lines of integer nucleotides, 80 by default). Set that value to zero to eliminate the wrapping (Recommended).

param.name: alpha
param.label: alpha

param.name: minsize
param.label: minsize
param.help: Defines the minimum number of sequences required for a cluster to be considered valid; if a cluster contains fewer sequences than the specified minsize, it will be discarded.

param.name: create_extended_json_reports
param.label: Create extended JSON reports
param.help: If set to True, the pipeline will generate additional JSON reports with detailed information about the analysis steps.

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**eDentity Metabarcoding Pipeline**
This pipeline is based on the vsearch tool for metabarcoding analysis. It generates Exact Sequence Variants (ESVs).
.. class:: warningmark
Note that this pipeline does not (currently) perform taxonomic identification; the ESVs produced can be used in downstream identification process.
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs** - **ESV_table**: A tsv file containing the ESV (Exact Sequence Variant) table: These are counts of each ESV per sample. - **summary_report**: A summary of the number of reads passing each step of analysis; e.g how many reads merged, what % was trimmed. - **ESV_fasta_zip**: A ZIP file containing the ESV sequences in FASTA format: This can be used for taxonomic identification. - **Quality_control_report**: A report with general quality metrics such as Q scores, sequence length, % GC, % of N bases, % of primer trimmed reads.
.. class:: infomark
**References**
- vsearch: https://doi.org/10.7717/peerj.2584 - APSCALE: https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btac588 - Technical details: https://gitlab.com/naturalis/bii/bioinformatics/edentity/pipelines/edentity-metabarcoding-pipeline.git
